member.name: F:Dlp.Buy4.Framework.Win32.NTStatusValue.STATUS_CALLBACK_RETURNED_THREAD_AFFINITY
member.summary: A threadpool worker thread entered a callback at thread affinity %p and exited at affinity %p. This is unexpected, indicating that the callback missed restoring the priority.

member.name: F:Dlp.Buy4.Framework.Win32.NTStatusValue.STATUS_OBJECT_NAME_EXISTS
member.summary: {Object Exists} An attempt was made to create an object but the object name already exists.

member.name: F:Dlp.Buy4.Framework.Win32.NTStatusValue.STATUS_THREAD_WAS_SUSPENDED
member.summary: {Thread Suspended} A thread termination occurred while the thread was suspended. The thread resumed, and termination proceeded.

member.name: F:Dlp.Buy4.Framework.Win32.NTStatusValue.STATUS_WORKING_SET_LIMIT_RANGE
member.summary: {Working Set Range Error} An attempt was made to set the working set minimum or maximum to values that are outside the allowable range.

member.name: F:Dlp.Buy4.Framework.Win32.NTStatusValue.STATUS_IMAGE_NOT_AT_BASE
member.summary: {Image Relocated} An image file could not be mapped at the address that is specified in the image file. Local fixes must be performed on this image.

member.name: F:Dlp.Buy4.Framework.Win32.NTStatusValue.STATUS_RXACT_STATE_CREATED
member.summary: This informational level status indicates that a specified registry subtree transaction state did not yet exist and had to be created.

member.name: F:Dlp.Buy4.Framework.Win32.NTStatusValue.STATUS_SEGMENT_NOTIFICATION
member.summary: {Segment Load} A virtual DOS machine (VDM) is loading, unloading, or moving an MS-DOS or Win16 program segment image. An exception is raised so that a debugger can load, unload, or track symbols and breakpoints within these 16-bit segments.

member.name: F:Dlp.Buy4.Framework.Win32.NTStatusValue.STATUS_LOCAL_USER_SESSION_KEY
member.summary: {Local Session Key} A user session key was requested for a local remote procedure call (RPC) connection. The session key that is returned is a constant value and not unique to this connection.

member.name: F:Dlp.Buy4.Framework.Win32.NTStatusValue.STATUS_BAD_CURRENT_DIRECTORY
member.summary: {Invalid Current Directory} The process cannot switch to the startup current directory %hs. Select OK to set the current directory to %hs, or select CANCEL to exit.

member.name: F:Dlp.Buy4.Framework.Win32.NTStatusValue.STATUS_SERIAL_MORE_WRITES
member.summary: {Serial IOCTL Complete} A serial I/O operation was completed by another write to a serial port. (The IOCTL_SERIAL_XOFF_COUNTER reached zero.)

member.name: F:Dlp.Buy4.Framework.Win32.NTStatusValue.STATUS_REGISTRY_RECOVERED
member.summary: {Registry Recovery} One of the files that contains the system registry data had to be recovered by using a log or alternate copy. The recovery was successful.

member.name: F:Dlp.Buy4.Framework.Win32.NTStatusValue.STATUS_FT_READ_RECOVERY_FROM_BACKUP
member.summary: {Redundant Read} To satisfy a read request, the Windows NT operating system fault-tolerant file system successfully read the requested data from a redundant copy. This was done because the file system encountered a failure on a member of the fault-tolerant volume but was unable to reassign the failing area of the device.

member.name: F:Dlp.Buy4.Framework.Win32.NTStatusValue.STATUS_FT_WRITE_RECOVERY
member.summary: {Redundant Write} To satisfy a write request, the Windows NT fault-tolerant file system successfully wrote a redundant copy of the information. This was done because the file system encountered a failure on a member of the fault-tolerant volume but was unable to reassign the failing area of the device.

member.name: F:Dlp.Buy4.Framework.Win32.NTStatusValue.STATUS_SERIAL_COUNTER_TIMEOUT
member.summary: {Serial IOCTL Timeout} A serial I/O operation completed because the time-out period expired. (The IOCTL_SERIAL_XOFF_COUNTER had not reached zero.)

member.name: F:Dlp.Buy4.Framework.Win32.NTStatusValue.STATUS_NULL_LM_PASSWORD
member.summary: {Password Too Complex} The Windows password is too complex to be converted to a LAN Manager password. The LAN Manager password that returned is a NULL string.

member.name: F:Dlp.Buy4.Framework.Win32.NTStatusValue.STATUS_IMAGE_MACHINE_TYPE_MISMATCH
member.summary: {Machine Type Mismatch} The image file %hs is valid but is for a machine type other than the current machine. Select OK to continue, or CANCEL to fail the DLL load.

member.name: F:Dlp.Buy4.Framework.Win32.NTStatusValue.STATUS_RECEIVE_PARTIAL
member.summary: {Partial Data Received} The network transport returned partial data to its client. The remaining data will be sent later.

member.name: F:Dlp.Buy4.Framework.Win32.NTStatusValue.STATUS_RECEIVE_EXPEDITED
member.summary: {Expedited Data Received} The network transport returned data to its client that was marked as expedited by the remote system.

member.name: F:Dlp.Buy4.Framework.Win32.NTStatusValue.STATUS_RECEIVE_PARTIAL_EXPEDITED
member.summary: {Partial Expedited Data Received} The network transport returned partial data to its client and this data was marked as expedited by the remote system. The remaining data will be sent later.

member.summary: {TDI Event Done} The TDI indication has completed successfully.

member.name: F:Dlp.Buy4.Framework.Win32.NTStatusValue.STATUS_ALLOTTED_SPACE_EXCEEDED
member.summary: When a block of memory is allotted for future updates, such as the memory allocated to hold discretionary access control and primary group information, successive updates may exceed the amount of memory originally allotted. Because a quota may already have been charged to several processes that have handles to the object, it is not reasonable to alter the size of the allocated memory. Instead, a request that requires more memory than has been allotted must fail and the STATUS_ALLOTTED_SPACE_EXCEEDED error returned.

member.name: F:Dlp.Buy4.Framework.Win32.NTStatusValue.STATUS_GRAPHICS_OPM_PROTECTED_OUTPUT_NO_LONGER_EXISTS
member.summary: The operating system asynchronously destroyed this OPM-protected output because the operating system state changed. This error typically occurs because the monitor PDO associated with this protected output was removed or stopped, the protected output's session became a nonconsole session, or the protected output's desktop became inactive.

member.name: F:Dlp.Buy4.Framework.Win32.NTStatusValue.STATUS_GRAPHICS_OPM_SESSION_TYPE_CHANGE_IN_PROGRESS
member.summary: OPM functions cannot be called when a session is changing its type. Three types of sessions currently exist: console, disconnected, and remote (RDP or ICA).

member.name: F:Dlp.Buy4.Framework.Win32.NTStatusValue.STATUS_GRAPHICS_OPM_PROTECTED_OUTPUT_DOES_NOT_HAVE_COPP_SEMANTICS
member.summary: The DxgkDdiOPMGetCOPPCompatibleInformation, DxgkDdiOPMGetInformation, or DxgkDdiOPMConfigureProtectedOutput function failed. This error is returned only if a protected output has OPM semantics. DxgkDdiOPMGetCOPPCompatibleInformation always returns this error if a protected output has OPM semantics. DxgkDdiOPMGetInformation returns this error code if the caller requested COPP-specific information. DxgkDdiOPMConfigureProtectedOutput returns this error when the caller tries to use a COPP-specific command.

member.name: F:Dlp.Buy4.Framework.Win32.NTStatusValue.STATUS_GRAPHICS_OPM_INVALID_INFORMATION_REQUEST
member.summary: The DxgkDdiOPMGetInformation and DxgkDdiOPMGetCOPPCompatibleInformation functions return this error code if the passed-in sequence number is not the expected sequence number or the passed-in OMAC value is invalid.

member.name: F:Dlp.Buy4.Framework.Win32.NTStatusValue.STATUS_GRAPHICS_OPM_DRIVER_INTERNAL_ERROR
member.summary: The function failed because an unexpected error occurred inside a display driver.

member.name: F:Dlp.Buy4.Framework.Win32.NTStatusValue.STATUS_GRAPHICS_OPM_PROTECTED_OUTPUT_DOES_NOT_HAVE_OPM_SEMANTICS
member.summary: The DxgkDdiOPMGetCOPPCompatibleInformation, DxgkDdiOPMGetInformation, or DxgkDdiOPMConfigureProtectedOutput function failed. This error is returned only if a protected output has COPP semantics. DxgkDdiOPMGetCOPPCompatibleInformation returns this error code if the caller requested OPM-specific information. DxgkDdiOPMGetInformation always returns this error if a protected output has COPP semantics. DxgkDdiOPMConfigureProtectedOutput returns this error when the caller tries to use an OPM-specific command.

member.summary: The DxgkDdiOPMGetCOPPCompatibleInformation and DxgkDdiOPMConfigureProtectedOutput functions return this error if the display driver does not support the DXGKMDT_OPM_GET_ACP_AND_CGMSA_SIGNALING and DXGKMDT_OPM_SET_ACP_AND_CGMSA_SIGNALING GUIDs.

member.name: F:Dlp.Buy4.Framework.Win32.NTStatusValue.STATUS_GRAPHICS_OPM_INVALID_CONFIGURATION_REQUEST
member.summary: The DxgkDdiOPMConfigureProtectedOutput function returns this error code if the passed-in sequence number is not the expected sequence number or the passed-in OMAC value is invalid.

member.name: T:Dlp.Buy4.Framework.Win32.Win32Constant
member.summary: Constants for the Win32 API.

member.name: F:Dlp.Buy4.Framework.Win32.Win32Constant.INVALID_HANDLE_VALUE
member.summary: Invalid handle constant.

member.name: F:Dlp.Buy4.Framework.Win32.Win32Constant.ATTACH_PARENT_PROCESS
member.summary: Used in function 'AttachConsole'. Use the console of the parent of the current process.

member.name: F:Dlp.Buy4.Framework.Win32.Win32Constant.CTRL_C_EVENT
member.summary: A CTRL+C signal was received, either from keyboard input or from a signal generated by the GenerateConsoleCtrlEvent function.

member.name: F:Dlp.Buy4.Framework.Win32.Win32Constant.CTRL_BREAK_EVENT
member.summary: A CTRL+BREAK signal was received, either from keyboard input or from a signal generated by GenerateConsoleCtrlEvent.

member.name: F:Dlp.Buy4.Framework.Win32.Win32Constant.CTRL_CLOSE_EVENT
member.summary: A signal that the system sends to all processes attached to a console when the user closes the console (either by clicking Close on the console window's window menu, or by clicking the End Task button command from Task Manager).

member.name: F:Dlp.Buy4.Framework.Win32.Win32Constant.CTRL_LOGOFF_EVENT
member.summary: A signal that the system sends to all console processes when a user is logging off. This signal does not indicate which user is logging off, so no assumptions can be made. Note that this signal is received only by services. Interactive applications are terminated at logoff, so they are not present when the system sends this signal.

member.name: F:Dlp.Buy4.Framework.Win32.Win32Constant.CTRL_SHUTDOWN_EVENT
member.summary: A signal that the system sends when the system is shutting down. Interactive applications are not present by the time the system sends this signal, therefore it can be received only be services in this situation. Services also have their own notification mechanism for shutdown events. For more information, see Handler. This signal can also be generated by an application using GenerateConsoleCtrlEvent.

member.name: F:Dlp.Buy4.Framework.Win32.Win32Constant.SW_FORCEMINIMIZE
member.summary: Minimizes a window, even if the thread that owns the window is not responding. This flag should only be used when minimizing windows from a different thread.

member.name: F:Dlp.Buy4.Framework.Win32.Win32Constant.SW_HIDE
member.summary: Hides the window and activates another window.

member.name: F:Dlp.Buy4.Framework.Win32.Win32Constant.SW_MAXIMIZE
member.summary: Maximizes the specified window.

member.name: F:Dlp.Buy4.Framework.Win32.Win32Constant.SW_MINIMIZE
member.summary: Minimizes the specified window and activates the next top-level window in the Z order.

member.name: F:Dlp.Buy4.Framework.Win32.Win32Constant.SW_NORMAL
member.summary: Activates and displays a window. If the window is minimized or maximized, the system restores it to its original size and position.

member.name: F:Dlp.Buy4.Framework.Win32.Win32Constant.SW_RESTORE
member.summary: Activates and displays the window. If the window is minimized or maximized, the system restores it to its original size and position. An application should specify this flag when restoring a minimized window.

member.name: F:Dlp.Buy4.Framework.Win32.Win32Constant.SW_SHOW
member.summary: Activates the window and displays it in its current size and position.

member.name: F:Dlp.Buy4.Framework.Win32.Win32Constant.SW_SHOWDEFAULT
member.summary: Sets the show state based on the SW_ value specified in the STARTUPINFO structure passed to the CreateProcess function by the program that started the application.

member.name: F:Dlp.Buy4.Framework.Win32.Win32Constant.SW_SHOWMAXIMIZED
member.summary: Activates the window and displays it as a maximized window.

member.name: F:Dlp.Buy4.Framework.Win32.Win32Constant.SW_SHOWMINIMIZED
member.summary: Activates the window and displays it as a minimized window.

member.name: F:Dlp.Buy4.Framework.Win32.Win32Constant.SW_SHOWMINNOACTIVE
member.summary: Displays the window as a minimized window. This value is similar to SW_SHOWMINIMIZED, except the window is not activated.

member.name: F:Dlp.Buy4.Framework.Win32.Win32Constant.SW_SHOWNA
member.summary: Displays the window in its current size and position. This value is similar to SW_SHOW, except that the window is not activated.

member.name: F:Dlp.Buy4.Framework.Win32.Win32Constant.SW_SHOWNOACTIVATE
member.summary: Displays a window in its most recent size and position. This value is similar to SW_SHOWNORMAL, except that the window is not activated.

member.name: F:Dlp.Buy4.Framework.Win32.Win32Constant.SW_SHOWNORMAL
member.summary: Activates and displays a window. If the window is minimized or maximized, the system restores it to its original size and position. An application should specify this flag when displaying the window for the first time.

member.name: F:Dlp.Buy4.Framework.Win32.HResultValue.ERROR_GRAPHICS_OPM_OUTPUT_DOES_NOT_SUPPORT_HDCP
member.summary: The video output cannot enable the HDCP system because it does not support it.

member.name: F:Dlp.Buy4.Framework.Win32.HResultValue.ERROR_GRAPHICS_OPM_OUTPUT_DOES_NOT_SUPPORT_ACP
member.summary: The video output cannot enable analog copy protection because it does not support it.

member.summary: The video output cannot enable the Content Generation Management System Analog (CGMS-A) protection technology because it does not support it.

member.summary: IOPMVideoOutput's GetInformation() method cannot return the version of the SRM being used because the application never successfully passed an SRM to the video output.

member.name: F:Dlp.Buy4.Framework.Win32.HResultValue.ERROR_GRAPHICS_OPM_RESOLUTION_TOO_HIGH
member.summary: IOPMVideoOutput's Configure() method cannot enable the specified output protection technology because the output's screen resolution is too high.

member.name: F:Dlp.Buy4.Framework.Win32.HResultValue.ERROR_GRAPHICS_OPM_ALL_HDCP_HARDWARE_ALREADY_IN_USE
member.summary: IOPMVideoOutput's Configure() method cannot enable HDCP because the display adapter's HDCP hardware is already being used by other physical outputs.

member.name: F:Dlp.Buy4.Framework.Win32.HResultValue.ERROR_GRAPHICS_OPM_VIDEO_OUTPUT_NO_LONGER_EXISTS
member.summary: The operating system asynchronously destroyed this OPM video output because the operating system's state changed. This error typically occurs because the monitor physical device object (PDO) associated with this video output was removed, the monitor PDO associated with this video output was stopped, the video output's session became a nonconsole session or the video output's desktop became an inactive desktop.

member.name: F:Dlp.Buy4.Framework.Win32.HResultValue.ERROR_GRAPHICS_OPM_SESSION_TYPE_CHANGE_IN_PROGRESS
member.summary: IOPMVideoOutput's methods cannot be called when a session is changing its type. There are currently three types of sessions: console, disconnected and remote (remote desktop protocol [RDP] or Independent Computing Architecture [ICA]).

member.name: F:Dlp.Buy4.Framework.Win32.HResultValue.ERROR_GRAPHICS_I2C_NOT_SUPPORTED
member.summary: The monitor connected to the specified video output does not have an I2C bus.

member.name: F:Dlp.Buy4.Framework.Win32.HResultValue.ERROR_GRAPHICS_I2C_DEVICE_DOES_NOT_EXIST
member.summary: No device on the I2C bus has the specified address.

member.name: F:Dlp.Buy4.Framework.Win32.HResultValue.ERROR_GRAPHICS_I2C_ERROR_TRANSMITTING_DATA
member.summary: An error occurred while transmitting data to the device on the I2C bus.

member.name: F:Dlp.Buy4.Framework.Win32.HResultValue.ERROR_GRAPHICS_I2C_ERROR_RECEIVING_DATA
member.summary: An error occurred while receiving data from the device on the I2C bus.

member.name: F:Dlp.Buy4.Framework.Win32.HResultValue.ERROR_GRAPHICS_DDCCI_VCP_NOT_SUPPORTED
member.summary: The monitor does not support the specified Virtual Control Panel (VCP) code.

member.name: F:Dlp.Buy4.Framework.Win32.HResultValue.ERROR_GRAPHICS_DDCCI_INVALID_DATA
member.summary: The data received from the monitor is invalid.

member.name: F:Dlp.Buy4.Framework.Win32.HResultValue.ERROR_GRAPHICS_DDCCI_MONITOR_RETURNED_INVALID_TIMING_STATUS_BYTE
member.summary: A function call failed because a monitor returned an invalid Timing Status byte when the operating system used the Display Data Channel Command Interface (DDC/CI) Get Timing Report and Timing Message command to get a timing report from a monitor.

member.name: F:Dlp.Buy4.Framework.Win32.HResultValue.ERROR_GRAPHICS_MCA_INVALID_CAPABILITIES_STRING
member.summary: The monitor returned a DDC/CI capabilities string that did not comply with the ACCESS.bus 3.0, DDC/CI 1.1 or MCCS 2 Revision 1 specification.

member.name: F:Dlp.Buy4.Framework.Win32.HResultValue.ERROR_GRAPHICS_MCA_INTERNAL_ERROR
member.summary: An internal Monitor Configuration API error occurred.

member.name: F:Dlp.Buy4.Framework.Win32.HResultValue.ERROR_GRAPHICS_DDCCI_INVALID_MESSAGE_COMMAND
member.summary: An operation failed because a DDC/CI message had an invalid value in its command field.

member.name: F:Dlp.Buy4.Framework.Win32.HResultValue.ERROR_GRAPHICS_DDCCI_INVALID_MESSAGE_LENGTH
member.summary: This error occurred because a DDC/CI message length field contained an invalid value.

member.name: F:Dlp.Buy4.Framework.Win32.HResultValue.ERROR_GRAPHICS_DDCCI_INVALID_MESSAGE_CHECKSUM
member.summary: This error occurred because the value in a DDC/CI message checksum field did not match the message's computed checksum value. This error implies that the data was corrupted while it was being transmitted from a monitor to a computer.

member.name: F:Dlp.Buy4.Framework.Win32.HResultValue.ERROR_GRAPHICS_PMEA_INVALID_MONITOR
member.summary: The HMONITOR no longer exists, is not attached to the desktop, or corresponds to a mirroring device.

member.name: F:Dlp.Buy4.Framework.Win32.HResultValue.ERROR_GRAPHICS_PMEA_INVALID_D3D_DEVICE
member.summary: The Direct3D (D3D) device's GDI display device no longer exists, is not attached to the desktop, or is a mirroring display device.

member.name: F:Dlp.Buy4.Framework.Win32.HResultValue.ERROR_GRAPHICS_DDCCI_CURRENT_CURRENT_VALUE_GREATER_THAN_MAXIMUM_VALUE
member.summary: A continuous VCP code's current value is greater than its maximum value. This error code indicates that a monitor returned an invalid value.

member.name: F:Dlp.Buy4.Framework.Win32.HResultValue.ERROR_GRAPHICS_MCA_INVALID_VCP_VERSION
member.summary: The monitor's VCP Version (0xDF) VCP code returned an invalid version value.

member.name: F:Dlp.Buy4.Framework.Win32.HResultValue.ERROR_GRAPHICS_MCA_MONITOR_VIOLATES_MCCS_SPECIFICATION
member.summary: The monitor does not comply with the Monitor Control Command Set (MCCS) specification it claims to support.

member.name: F:Dlp.Buy4.Framework.Win32.HResultValue.ERROR_GRAPHICS_MCA_MCCS_VERSION_MISMATCH
member.summary: The MCCS version in a monitor's mccs_ver capability does not match the MCCS version the monitor reports when the VCP Version (0xDF) VCP code is used.

member.name: F:Dlp.Buy4.Framework.Win32.HResultValue.ERROR_GRAPHICS_MCA_UNSUPPORTED_MCCS_VERSION
member.summary: The Monitor Configuration API only works with monitors that support the MCCS 1.0 specification, the MCCS 2.0 specification, or the MCCS 2.0 Revision 1 specification.

member.name: F:Dlp.Buy4.Framework.Win32.HResultValue.ERROR_GRAPHICS_MCA_INVALID_TECHNOLOGY_TYPE_RETURNED
member.summary: The monitor returned an invalid monitor technology type. CRT, plasma, and LCD (TFT) are examples of monitor technology types. This error implies that the monitor violated the MCCS 2.0 or MCCS 2.0 Revision 1 specification.

member.name: F:Dlp.Buy4.Framework.Win32.HResultValue.ERROR_GRAPHICS_MCA_UNSUPPORTED_COLOR_TEMPERATURE
member.summary: The SetMonitorColorTemperature() caller passed a color temperature to it that the current monitor did not support. CRT, plasma, and LCD (TFT) are examples of monitor technology types. This error implies that the monitor violated the MCCS 2.0 or MCCS 2.0 Revision 1 specification.

member.name: F:Dlp.Buy4.Framework.Win32.HResultValue.ERROR_GRAPHICS_ONLY_CONSOLE_SESSION_SUPPORTED
member.summary: This function can be used only if a program is running in the local console session. It cannot be used if the program is running on a remote desktop session or on a terminal server session.

member.name: T:Dlp.Buy4.Framework.Win32.Win32Api
member.summary: Encapsulation for Win32 API.

member.name: T:Dlp.Buy4.Framework.Win32.Win32Api.ConsoleCtrlHandler
member.summary: An application-defined function used with the 'SetConsoleCtrlHandler' function. A console process uses this function to handle control signals received by the process. When the signal is received, the system creates a new thread in the process to execute the function.
member.param: The type of control signal received by the handler.
member.returns: If the function handles the control signal, it should return 'true'. If it returns 'false', the next handler function in the list of handlers for this process is used.

member.name: M:Dlp.Buy4.Framework.Win32.Win32Api.AllocConsole
member.summary: Allocates a new console for the calling process.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is 'true'.

member.name: M:Dlp.Buy4.Framework.Win32.Win32Api.AttachConsole(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Attaches the calling process to the console of the specified process.
member.param: The identifier of the process whose console is to be used. This parameter can be one of the following values. - pid: Use the console of the specified process. - ATTACH_PARENT_PROCESS: Use the console of the parent of the current process.

member.name: M:Dlp.Buy4.Framework.Win32.Win32Api.FreeConsole
member.summary: Detaches the calling process from its console.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is 'true'.

member.name: M:Dlp.Buy4.Framework.Win32.Win32Api.GetConsoleCP
member.summary: Retrieves the input code page used by the console associated with the calling process. A console uses its input code page to translate keyboard input into the corresponding character value.
member.returns: The return value is a code that identifies the code page.

member.name: M:Dlp.Buy4.Framework.Win32.Win32Api.GetConsoleOutputCP
member.summary: Retrieves the output code page used by the console associated with the calling process. A console uses its output code page to translate the character values written by the various output functions into the images displayed in the console window.
member.returns: The return value is a code that identifies the code page.

member.name: M:Dlp.Buy4.Framework.Win32.Win32Api.GetConsoleProcessList(System.UInt32[],System.UInt32)
member.summary: Retrieves a list of the processes attached to the current console.
member.param: A pointer to a buffer that receives an array of process identifiers upon success.
The maximum number of process identifiers that can be stored in the lpdwProcessList buffer.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is less than or equal to dwProcessCount and represents the number of process identifiers stored in the lpdwProcessList buffer. If the buffer is too small to hold all the valid process identifiers, the return value is the required number of array elements. The function will have stored no identifiers in the buffer. In this situation, use the return value to allocate a buffer that is large enough to store the entire list and call the function again. If the return value is zero, the function has failed, because every console has at least one process associated with it.

member.name: M:Dlp.Buy4.Framework.Win32.Win32Api.GetConsoleWindow
member.summary: Retrieves the window handle used by the console associated with the calling process.
member.returns: The return value is a handle to the window used by the console associated with the calling process or 'IntPtr.Zero' if there is no such associated console.

member.name: M:Dlp.Buy4.Framework.Win32.Win32Api.SetConsoleCP(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Sets the input code page used by the console associated with the calling process. A console uses its input code page to translate keyboard input into the corresponding character value.
member.param: The identifier of the code page to be set.

member.name: M:Dlp.Buy4.Framework.Win32.Win32Api.SetConsoleCtrlHandler(Dlp.Buy4.Framework.Win32.Win32Api.ConsoleCtrlHandler,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Adds or removes an application-defined HandlerRoutine function from the list of handler functions for the calling process. If no handler function is specified, the function sets an inheritable attribute that determines whether the calling process ignores CTRL+C signals.
member.param: A pointer to the application-defined HandlerRoutine function to be added or removed. This parameter can be 'null'.

If this parameter is 'true', the handler is added; if it is 'false', the handler is removed. If the HandlerRoutine parameter is 'null', a 'true' value causes the calling process to ignore CTRL+C input, and a 'false' value restores normal processing of CTRL+C input. This attribute of ignoring or processing CTRL+C is inherited by child processes.

member.name: M:Dlp.Buy4.Framework.Win32.Win32Api.SetConsoleOutputCP(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Sets the output code page used by the console associated with the calling process. A console uses its output code page to translate the character values written by the various output functions into the images displayed in the console window.
member.param: The identifier of the code page to be set.
